data.text: @tranastasia_ I don't think it matters how ANYONE wears their hair.

@monselovescesar White people get lice and Greasy hair. That's unkept too. Everyone has to keep up with their hair. Hygiene. I have biracial children. With curly hair.  And I'm a licensed servicing both ethic and Caucasian hair types. Braids and perms. Edges and kitchens. Everyone has to keep up.

@bigbrownqueer @KimKardashian I done heard it all. Now y'all mad white people have straight hair. And ethic has to conform to straight hair to get further in life? EDUCATION. Will get you where you need to be. Just wanna be mad about everything. White people can wear braids,  black people can straighten. #ONE
@bigbrownqueer Can’t stand the Kardashians. But to criticize braids? Fucking idiot.

@bigbrownqueer She needs to stay in her lane; Dammmmmmmm like fo real she loves copying Beyonce; there is only #1 Queen Bey#

##Kanye West you could have done better, like wit a Beautiful; Natural, Black Woman##
@bigbrownqueer Let her have braid her hair. Some of us were not born with blond hair is that ok.  Can we dye our hair blond and weave straight hair.

@bigbrownqueer 🤣🤣🤣 you are mad 🤣🤣🤣
It’s a hairstyle

@bigbrownqueer It’s hair. NO one culture owns braids many cultures have worn braids and still do. Women can do wtf they like with their hair. Choose how you wear your own hair but don’t claim exclusive rights to a hairstyle and tell others what they can do with theirs.

@bigbrownqueer This isn't cultural appropriation, this is MARRIAGE.  This is what spouses do - adopt cultural practices, norms & traditions from their spouse & his/her family, so that the children understand & honor EVERYWHERE they come from.

@bigbrownqueer @ItsKayBee Are you f***g serious, it's her responsability to stand in as a MOTHER, it doesn't matter if black or white or green. You cannot be serious when you're saying that she should let her daughter's hair be Kayne and his family's problem 😂😂
@Nexusflame @bigbrownqueer Some people just want to keep racism going, and that is @bigbrownqueer, so sad

@bigbrownqueer Building walls again? Wanting people from other cultures to show no interest in yours is an argument for segregation. No tattoos for anyone who is not Greek, Polynesian or Celtic. No bicycles, cars or computers if you are not of European descent and no plaid except for celts

@bigbrownqueer These cultural appropriation fanatics are pathetic. These braids are called FULANI BRAIDS. Fulani ARE A TRIBE FOUND IN THE SAHARA or in the North of Nigeria. If you dont dress like the woman below in Fulani dress then you are guilty too https://t.co/yM9fx4fCOs

@ItsKayBee @bigbrownqueer It doesn't matter she did it. Pathetic idiots like the one you replied to will accept no version of events, no matter how ridiculously snow flakey they make themselves come off. These prop!e obviously don't have real life issues. Empty lives.
@bigbrownqueer This is ridiculous. People need to get a grip. Romans rocked braids 2000 years ago for starters. I bet I could you apart for cultural appropriation, if I was pathetic enough.
@bigbrownqueer Okay so we Scottish people invented the TV so the rest of you can turn that shit off!  #CulturalAppropriation
@bigbrownqueer @ItsKayBee She has to know her place as a white woman? Listen to yourself... disgusting .
@bigbrownqueer @DorieJH Black people wearing their hair straight.... is cultural appropriation? 90% black celebs should be getting shit for that then? But yer silent. 👌
@bigbrownqueer @Ericmic68888650 Many cultures braided their hair, not just Africans.
@bigbrownqueer FYI if Kim were Bo Derek I'd agree but because she is Armenian and they too wear Braids as a symbol of their culture plus she has children of African Decent I can't go with it.
@bigbrownqueer If you’re upset by it you’re a fucking idiot.

@bigbrownqueer And then you went off the rails...on the self righteous judgement train again. You don't think a Mother should be a Mother to her own Child because of the Color of her skin. I bet you pray to Jesus too.

@bigbrownqueer I wear my natural everything all day everyday so this is mute! And yes I have a job, no I haven't felt the pressure you speak of and no I don't love myself any less. This isn't an act this is life! Let people live!
@bigbrownqueer Okay let's have black people and white people live completely segregated lives. Is that what you'd prefer?

@Nexusflame @bigbrownqueer 'There are literally places that forbid black hairstyles'.
There are also literally people who forbid black hairstyles. You're one of them. The hypocrisy game is strong with this one.

@bigbrownqueer @Nexusflame The only one having a tantrum is you. You're the one that's triggered with race issues. Everyone else is happy to share customs/ cultures. Unfortunately racists like you come along wanting to segregate us into black and white.
@bigbrownqueer You people so sad
@bigbrownqueer @Joe88685236 @Ericmic68888650 BS, pure and simple. Some idiot came up with the stupid term and you’re simply running with it. Culture is shared and always evolving. Get over yourself.
@bigbrownqueer Oh shut the fuck up, grow up, and get a hobby. Your fake outrage over literally nothing only shows how emotionally deranged you are.

@bigbrownqueer @Nexusflame Why don't  you concern yourself with things THAT REALLY MATTER.  You must have a really boring life or too much time on your hands to fret over such an insignificant thing as someone's hair style.  Get a life!!We
@bigbrownqueer @DorieJH Like there aren't worse things happening in the USA now? Bet the kids who have been separated from their parents don't give a flying fuck about her hair. Grow the fuck up

@bigbrownqueer Cultural appropriation,No such thing !From time immemorial,we have copied each other regardless of race color or https://t.co/WRmiFywywC lefties need to stop all this before a war between the whole human race starts.Oh and you are an idiot !
@bigbrownqueer Or she just wants to wear braids and that's nobody's business but her's.
@bigbrownqueer @Nexusflame Shouldn’t you focus your ire on the people / institutions that allegedly forbid black hairstyles rather than on a person who appears to admire them?
@bigbrownqueer @AxelTruther Did they not teach you punctuation or grammar as part of your Ivy League degree?

@monselovescesar @CristiMcCulloch Well then isn’t the issue that places like school won’t allow you to wear braids or your natural hair? Is that what we should be campaigning against?   I can’t believe I’m getting into this mess. I’m just trying to understand even if it may be hopeless for me.
@OnlyBlake @bigbrownqueer @DorieJH What a lovely person....
@bigbrownqueer @DorieJH It is not a style meant for afro hair you fuckin retard......anyone with any hair type can do it......its a black style ffs its 2018......grow the fuck up
@bigbrownqueer Shut yo dumbass up whining about "cultural appropriation", find something else to cry about
@T4RIG I don’t think you read the previous tweet.  So please come back when you do. Please don’t insult me.

@curlytopqt69 @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer The Medium article;
https://t.co/x3L9ucfnsG

@curlytopqt69 @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer But common in modern Europeans, particularly those in modern eastern Med/turkey (old Anatolia). It’s by no means conclusive, but it’s a lot more complex than people think. He could of been black. But if he was, he looks more Ethiopian than anything else. 2/2

@curlytopqt69 @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer There is still debate as to whether King Tut was ‘black’ as is understood today. A scientist who tried to map his DNA in 2012 (the Arab spring) released some findings that seem to show that he belonged to an ancestral group that is rare in modern in modern Egypt, 1/2

@bigbrownqueer But why does it really matter ? 
All females have been wearing braided hair all the time just like Kim, I despise the Kardashians and think they're rich asshats but seriously hop off hee dick about it. Who the fuck cares.
@bigbrownqueer Last I checked Kim isn't really white now is she?
@bigbrownqueer Stfu no it’s not

@bigbrownqueer Just because black people braid their hair for a particular reason doesnt mean other people can’t do it for their own reasons. There’s no copyright. I absolutely defend my right to wear my hair any way I like.
@baxter_daniel @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer  https://t.co/0UDe87lDxK
@baxter_daniel @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer I know we're talking about Cleopatra  but look at Tutankhamun. Look at his features. Looks black to me https://t.co/Mn4VJhlDDM
@curlytopqt69 @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer And no one is denying she or other ancient Egyptians weren’t Africans. They just weren’t black Africans.

@curlytopqt69 @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer A) pretty sure the Macedonian Greeks came from Macedonia, b) it’s likely ‘civilisation’ started in Mesopotamia (yah know. The cradle of civilisation as it’s otherwise known), and c) by that logic no one has claim to any culture. The last one I am down with.
@bigbrownqueer i didnt even know she had braids because i pay no attention to her. try that. im sure knowing about her life in general is exhausting enough
@bigbrownqueer You find this hair style was about in well before bc
@bigbrownqueer @DorieJH You probably need to take it up with the schools and businesses.
@baxter_daniel @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer Where did the Macedonian Greeks come from? Civilization started in Africa. Egypt is in where? Africa. And who's from Africa?  Say it with me...Africans

@bigbrownqueer @Nexusflame Denying history? 
Like denying the Umayyad conquests
The mongols
the Ottoman Empire 
The Barbary Pirates

@bigbrownqueer @DorieJH But is it? We have to apply serious heat or chemicals to our hair if we want to wear it straight, assuming that it's not not us black women to have straight hair. But we do and it suits us, as do braids and other styles. If another culture can appreciate braids, where's the harm?

@bigbrownqueer @Ericmic68888650 Yes they do, but that doesn't mean they are or should then become a style exclusive to just black people. I'm not a fan of KKW but i as a black female do not see the issue when it comes to the braids. Cultural appropriation is important to call out but I don't see this as that
@bigbrownqueer Braids are a european custom. There 3000 year old depictions of braids on statues and pots. Sorry girlfriend..
@cuuuuzz @bigbrownqueer @Joe88685236 @Ericmic68888650 How long will it take for this to go from hair to food I wonder

@bigbrownqueer as #MelaniaTrump 's jacket would say: Don't really care! Since when can you not wear what you want or do your hair anyway you like? I wear Chinese Qipao's and African prints. So? they're nice clothes and the fit well.

@curlytopqt69 @rita_norred @bigbrownqueer No, she wasn’t - she was a descendant of a Macedonian Greek general. https://t.co/KCqmrJOGjD. Current genetics says that ancient Egyptians had more in common with Anatolian and Eastern Mediterranean Europeans. https://t.co/BQU9qmRCAw

@bigbrownqueer @AxelTruther Nobody cares that you have a meaningless piece of paper from some bullshit university. Nobody cares how many God-awful Kimberlé Crenshaw books you've read. Stop trying to tell people what they can and cannot do with their own hair you authoritarian POS.
@bigbrownqueer Get a life & stop obsessing over what people do with their hair. They don't need your permission. This faux outrage is ridiculous.
@bigbrownqueer @Joe88685236 @Ericmic68888650 Lots of different societies (made up of lots of different ethnicities) invented or have used braiding over the millennia.
@bigbrownqueer But she is married to a Black guy, as a result she must adopt the husband's culture. That's how we roll here in Africa. Don't know about Trump's America.

@cuuuuzz @bigbrownqueer @Joe88685236 @Ericmic68888650 One might also look at other past cultures, China, Japan, Mongolians, Phoenicians, Assyrians, Babylonians, Greeks, Romans, Germanic, Celts (northern France/Britannia), Nordics, North American tribes, all had braided hair and agree it belongs to all
@bigbrownqueer @Nexusflame If there are literally hundreds, provide evidence of one.
@bigbrownqueer @AxelTruther No offence, but you really do not sound educated, if that is the effect you are going for.
@bigbrownqueer @DorieJH She's married to a black dude. Relax.
@bigbrownqueer Google Venus of Willendorf, Austria, 30000 years ago.

@bigbrownqueer Lets list other examples of 'cultural appropriation' apart the neighbouring tribes that took this style from the fulani ppl. Music... anyone heard of J Dilla sampling classical music? Fashion... so many wannabe cowboys wearing denim. I could go on... PPL we are all human. 1 Love

@bigbrownqueer Does this means that anyone with a tattoo is guilty of cultural appropriation as it stems from Maori and other cultures ?
Surely that, and black women straightening their hair annoys you too ?
@bigbrownqueer So Beyonce has to give up her blonde straight hair?
@bigbrownqueer @HazelelariaNeal calm down...n I repeat stop wearing wigs that resembles their hair...Arrrgh..stop with ths black culture shenanigans..Arrghh!!!

@bigbrownqueer https://t.co/hrqvZFOis7
@bigbrownqueer Um just because it’s near doesn’t automatically mean she’s white.
@bigbrownqueer She’s not even white though she’s Armenian. She’s a minority like us.

@bigbrownqueer I’m personally black and have lineage all the way back to Trinidad and at least two different Native American tribes i understand that stealing and not giving credit where credit is due is horrendously wrong but saying they can’t wear a specific style isn’t right either.

@bigbrownqueer Okay so i just saw the documentary about braids. They literally say they want recognition of what culture started the braiding movement. They don’t mind other cultures wearing braids or cornrows they dislike the fact that Bo Derek made it trendy when our people were the originals
@dwayne10377169 @Ericmic68888650 Good for you, they still exist

@ItsKayBee Idk how you came to that conclusion, I’m just saying that it’s likely she’d say anything to get the heat off of her and consulted with her team to filter whatever they told the press so she wouldn’t show her ignorance.
@bigbrownqueer So this isn't about the Braids or the Culture it's about Kim. I get it! ✌🏽

@ItsKayBee What Kim puts out goes through her publicist, she’s a product, this article proves nothing and just shows her reach to justify it. If she put that much thought into it she just would have not done it, she knows it upsets people.

@ItsKayBee Besides, you’re acting as if Black women weren’t FORCED to conform to whiteness and taught to hate their natural hair because of years of systemic racism, you can’t draw parallels because of this thing called POWER DYNAMICS

@bigbrownqueer Read up Sis! Everything and everyone is not as nefarious as you believe them to be.
https://t.co/6e5odUurXI

@ItsKayBee Blonde isnt part of a culture, the Fulani braids, a culture in West Africa, where her braiding style originated IS. You’re just proving that you don’t have he depth to have this intellectual discussion, it’s deeper than just hair
@bigbrownqueer As her Mother it is her place and God given right to teach her child whatever she wishes.

@bigbrownqueer I bet you won't post anything about all the Women of color that appropriate Euro Culture...you know the ones that cover their braids with blonde wigs or the ones who sew Euro hair on top of their Culture! Do that and we'll believe you care about culture.

@ItsKayBee It’s not Kim’s place to decide how to teach North Black culture, she should realize that as a White woman. Besides, you’re reaching by saying she did this with North or for her, she’s done this before, so you really think she thought about it that deeply

@bigbrownqueer A Mother is a Mother and as a Mother we are to help our Children understand all aspects of WHO they are and not let outsiders define them. Kudos to Kim for being what a Mother should be to her child...A Mother!
@bigbrownqueer That's why she did it! So she should have stayed in the house?

@HazelelariaNeal That’s just not true, cornrows are specifically black, individuals are specifically Black. My argument was never that all braids are exclusive to African culture, but these are and were formed to care for Black hair. You don’t have the range to argue this hun
@bigbrownqueer Braids aren’t exclusive to African culture. They were worn by many other cultures , in the same form and even more elaborate than this particular style.
@ItsKayBee She can share in her culture, but doing braids for fun and braiding her hair with North as a cultural experience are separate and different things

@ItsKayBee It’s not her responsibility to stand in as a Black mother, she has Kanye and his family for that, she has to realize her place as a White woman in that dynamic. You turning it into mother daughter braids as if Kim doesn’t press Norths hair  so she won’t have to deal with it

@bigbrownqueer What about her Daughter? Is she not to share in her Childrens Culture? Is she only to acknowledge the Armenian part of them? Every Mother would do Mommy & Me braids at the request of their child. Should she have told her Daughter "No Mommy can't wear braids"? 🤔

@dwayne10377169 @Ericmic68888650 Gurl bye, nobody’s buying Caucasian hair to begin with, it’s mostly Malaysian, Brazilian, and Indian. Which leads me to my next point, women of any race can have straight hair, including Black women, didn’t know you personally knew every Black woman and could attest to that
@bigbrownqueer You do realise before Caucasian and Black people came across each other there was braiding going on in cultures in both races?

@bigbrownqueer @Joe88685236 @Ericmic68888650 I wouldn’t waste anymore time explaining anything 2the very oppressors that don’t give a damn about anything past their FALSE white supremacy.2THEM, It’s just hair, it’s just slavery, it’s just the race card...STAY PROUD WITHOUT THEIR IGNORANCE, STUPIDITY & APPROVAL! BLACK&PROUD!

@bigbrownqueer Weird. Do you show the same annoyance when black people dye their hair blonde?  Don’t give me the cultural appropriation BS. Why can’t someone just like a hairstyle?  Why can’t someone do something because they appreciate it without being called ignorant or showing privilege? Smh

@bigbrownqueer I don’t understand. Honestly I promise you I’m not a racist person, but why is it cultural appropriation when she where’s braids but not cultural appropriation when someone of colour dyes their hair blonde/puts blue contacts in?

@bigbrownqueer She does not need to change her hair because people get offended. If she lived her life like that she wouldn’t do anything do you know how much people like you harass her about anything 😴😴😴
@bigbrownqueer A hair style is not just for one race🤦🏽‍♀️

@Rafas0147 Is it bullshit because you can’t understand it or because you’re tired of hearing about it. Because anyone with a historical understanding of white supremacy and colonialism knows that cultural appropriation is a thing. Whether or not you care is a different issue.
@Puddin06919340 Tell me where in the hell blonde is a culture, a hair color is not cultural. Braiding and braiding styles that are meant to maintain kinky, African hair is cultural.

@YorsehKoroma @TharaFofana I’m not a bot, just a bitch with a lot of opinions I don’t wanna air on my real page. Just because this discussion is too much for small minded people to understand doesn’t make it nonsensical and doesn’t make me a bot

@AxelTruther Bitch I just graduated with an Ivy League degree, you don’t know me or what I know, what books have you read to be in the position to have an actual intellectual conversation about hegemonic white supremacy, assimilation, and power dynamics?
@bigbrownqueer @TharaFofana @bigbrownqueer are you a bot who's just here to put up nonsensical argument about braids just for blacks to seem stupid. Because....I'm afraid o

@CristiMcCulloch @bigbrownqueer @KimKardashian Viking women have been wearing braids. American Native Indians have been wearing braids. She could have ancestry from both.  Can't claim something. Not important. Worry about real issues like plastic in oceans.

@cuuuuzz Sure, criticizing cultural appropriation is keeping the world apart, not economic and social inequality, war, and intolerance. You don’t seem to have the depth for this conversation, see your way out

@bigbrownqueer *sigh*  You're so hell bent on throwing racism into the equation when the reality is that everyone "appropriates" things from other cultures.  Blacks have done it, whites have done it, asians have done it.. everyone does.  But you just want to focus on hate and that's it.  So sad

@bigbrownqueer I mean are you going to bitch about the fact that you have to wear the same uniform as everyone else in the military?  or the fact that you can't have an afro there? You kids need to grow the fuck up.. seriously...

@Nexusflame And our ideas of a professional look are rooted in White supremacy. You know that Black people weren’t allowed in many forms of public life not even 100 years ago in the US? Of course black hairstyles are considered “unprofessional” to white people, because they’re racist

@Nexusflame I broke it down in a way more complex way, it’s not as simple as cultural exchange, it’s about power dynamics and double standards. You’re too self absorbed to see the nuance, or maybe just too stupid

@bigbrownqueer There are literally schools and jobs that have dress codes and certain requirements that you have to meet in order to work there.. yes I know.  But guess what?  IT'S NOT BASED ON YOUR RACE.  It's based on having a professional look or a uniform look.

@bigbrownqueer Pfft.. you're so self absorbed you can't even see beyond your own narrow vision.  You have this stream lined view of "oh well don't do something that another culture does because it's wrong" when we have the rest of human history to tell you that hey that's what we've always done

@Nexusflame THERE ARE LITERALLY SCHOOLS AND JOBS THAT FORBID BLACK HAIRSTYLES. You are obviously uninformed and are having a tantrum because your white fragility is triggered with any race issues that aren’t cloaked in colorblind BS

@Nexusflame You’re so fucking dense, a person can concentrate on more than one topic. You don’t know what I do for economic or racial justice so fuck off. I’m sure the work you do is some White savior bullshit. You have no understanding of nuance or interest of looking beyond yourself
@bigbrownqueer "Black women aren't allowed to wear braids"  are you even listening to yourself?  Do you know how insanely stupid that sounds?

@Nexusflame You’re equating human evolution, things that are millennia old or top-down or examples of assimilation to modern human history. History that manifests itself in ways today. Black women aren’t allowed to wear braids like hers in schools and job TODAY bcuz of that history

@bigbrownqueer LMFAO.. black hair.. "omg black hair is SO GOD DAMNED IMPORTANT! IT'S RUINING OUR COUNTRY! STOP TAKING BLACK HAIR!" How about getting behind a movement like trying to get our african american community out of poverty and stop bitching about hair.  That's what I work on...

@bigbrownqueer Listen.. you're refusing to even admit to the evolution of humanity and try to use something that happens to be "current" as something new and intrusive and wrong.. when we've been doing it FOR EVER.  Stop crying over something made up.. find something IMPORTANT to stand behind.

@Nexusflame You need to get off your fucking high horse and realize when you don’t have the intellectual or practical knowledge to discuss Black hair. You’re having a tantrum sir, so how about you grow up.

@bigbrownqueer Do you have ANY IDEA how much of japanese culture is appropriated from china, korea, etc...?  A LOT of it... hell their ENTIRE LANGUAGE was originally based off of chinese.  Oh but the white man this.. the white man that.  You need to grow up.. seriously.

@Nexusflame “In my terms” I didn’t ever define it, you’re just drawing these arbitrary parallels to things that don’t relate and have absolutely nothing to do with what we’re talking about. You can’t compare human evolution to recent history and contemporary history.

@bigbrownqueer But hey.. now you want to bring RACE into it which I find laughable.  This is mainly due to the fact that you're over there trying to say "oh the white man has done all of this" REALLY now?

@bigbrownqueer Hell.. your EDUCATION is culturally appropriated.   If you want to break it down and nitpick.. I can pull quite a bit out of what you do on a daily basis as something culturally appropriated.  It's a made up term so people have an excuse to be pissed off about something.
@bigbrownqueer RACIST!

@bigbrownqueer How about the clothes you're wearing right now?  I'm willing to bet 100% that at least ONE thing you're wearing right now could be considered "culturally appropriated".  How about some of the food you cook?  How about some of your furniture?

@bigbrownqueer You think that language you're using right now is yours to use?  English (in your terms) is cultural appropriation.  It's borrowed borrowed from several different languages especially if you use slang terms....

@bigbrownqueer Who's denying history?  It's the fact that you're adamantly refuse to open your eyes to.  The fact that all of human evolution is the result of borrowing and adapting things from other societies/cultures in order to progress forward.

@bigbrownqueer Why can’t we all share each other’s ideas, cultures... that’s what comes with a multi-cultural society! If you don’t like it, go somewhere else! White women have straight, wavy or curly Afro hair. They ain’t appropriating anything, get over yourself! Stop trying to be a victim 😂
@Nexusflame It’s stupid to deny history and paint it as this cumbaya level playing field BS and denying the hegemony of White supremacy in world history the last few centuries

@bigbrownqueer Kim wears braids and this is massive news? She stealing someone’s culture? No she ain’t. She experimenting with hair! Just like Bey, Rih or any other black woman does when they straighten their hair or wear a blonde wig and I don’t get triggered by it because I ain’t pathetic!!

@bigbrownqueer EVERYONE has done it.  Every country, every culture, on every part of the planet.  This is how we started from the day we came down from the trees until present time.  White, black, asian, hispanic.. .doesn't matter.  It's how we grow and evolve.  It's stupid to think otherwise.

@Nexusflame “We” haven’t. European have at one point colonized 95% of the worlds nations, taken their resources, and reproduced/adopted their cultural traditions for their profit/credit. It may just seem like hair, but there is history and racial power dynamics behind it

@DorieJH And it’s a problem because of the societal double standard. Non-Black women like Kim are able to experiment with Black hair styles without facing the same stigma and criticism that’s Black women face. Kim knows this and has been told but keeps doing it and upsetting Black women

@DorieJH Exactly, your hair is too thin for it because it’s a style meant for afro-textured hair. Just like Black hair naturally locks when you twists it together to form dreadlocks, and thinner straighter hair can’t. Which is exactly the basis of my argument, it is a Black style
@bigbrownqueer You are racist. So, cornrows are only for one race now and nobody else can wear them or it's racist? This is racism at its finest.

@KnowHistory79 @sicksadfiction Well then why did your original response talk about “freedom of speech as long as it’s what you believe in, right?” You obviously don’t have the intelectual or practical breadth to have an academic or cultural discussion on Black hair. Your equivalencias and comparisons are based

@ShelleyStinton And if you think it’s ugly, my case is closed. You obviously don’t know many Black people and are way out of your league talking about issues relevant to Black women and Black hair as a White woman who thinks this argument just boils down to a hairstyle and not racial dynamics

@ShelleyStinton I mentioned that you’re White because it makes sense that the first person you saw in the braids was Bo Derek, a white woman, even though the style is really popular with Black people. I can’t even mention that you’re White without triggering your White guilt 🙄
@bigbrownqueer Typical for  u to say im mad when i dont care about your time or you . You just like trolling celebrities and say its for the culture when u ain’t for the culture peace
@monselovescesar @CristiMcCulloch Why don’t you see it as someone who is supporting the cause because she is raising black kids 🙄
@busi731 @KimKardashian You don’t know me or what I know, but go awff

@bigbrownqueer BBQ Sauce seriously!!!! Just leave it you know nothing about African culture.... @KimKardashian rock them braids sister, you look sooo good in them. I am tired of all these people that hide behind culture or whatever just to take down other people.

@DorieJH Are you really entitled to the point that you can’t consider for a second that this may be an issue that you as a White person cannot understand because your relationship to hair is different than Black women’s relationship to hair.

@DorieJH The style Kim HAD ON is specific to Black women - period. White women like Kim get the pass to experiment with styles not even meant for her hair type, while women are fired or taken out of school for wearing the same styles, which indeed have roots in Black culture, education=🔑

@BluLos There are black women with naturally straight hair, just cuz u haven’t seen em doesn’t mean they don’t exist. The point went over ur head. Straight hair/wigs isn’t specific to a single culture. And ironic that ur mad I’m wasting time with this yet u wasted ur time replying to me

@Joe88685236 @Ericmic68888650 It’s a hairstyle created by and for Black people for Black hair. Many Black people are still not allowed to wear it at school and their jobs and are labeled as low class or uncivilized for wearing those same styles, while Kim is just able to put it on w/o facing the same backlash

@KnowHistory79 @sicksadfiction Egyptians didn’t invent makeup, they were the first known people to use it, but it arose across many cultures separately, it’s not the same thing. Get it through your head, the style Kim wore was created by Black people for Black hair, that is just a fact
